iati-activity.title: Chars Livelihoods Programme
iati-activity.description: Improved livelihood security for poor and vulnerable women, men and children living within the riverine areas of five districts of the northern Jamuna (Chars are Sand Islands created as a result of river erosion and silt deposition. They are unstable and flood regularly).

iati-activity.title: Strengthening Political Participation in Bangladesh
iati-activity.description: To contribute to a political system that is more capable, accountable and responsive, especially to the needs of the poor and marginalised, by strengthening the skills and systems of the Election Commission, supporting the work of Parliament Committees to become more open and effective, influencing political parties to be more responsive to citizens; and strengthening the checks and balances on the political process, through civil society advocacy for more responsive political institutions
iati-activity.sector: Public sector policy and administrative management

contact-info.mailing-address: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

iati-activity.related-activity: Appraisal and Design - Strengthening Political Participation in Bangladesh
SPP - DFID Contribution to USAID for Partnership for Democratic Governance
SPP - Grant to Westminster Foundation for Democracy for Bangladesh Political Party and Parliament Capacity Building Project
SPP - Grant to Transparency International Bangladesh for Social movement against corruption.
SPP - Further Support to Election Commission for 10th Parliamentary election
SPP - Strategic Fund for Political Analysis
SPP - Grant to Transparency International Bangladesh for Social movement against corruption: Capital items
Accountable Grant to National Democratic Institute for Monitoring of Local Election in Bangladesh
Strengthening civic engagement in elections and political processes for enhanced transparency and democratic accountability
Monitoring and Evaluation of Strengthening Political Participation programme
Construction of Server Station
Strengthening Transparency International Bangladesh’s capacity to fight corruption through enhanced knowledge management and communications
To strengthen democratic accountability in the political process in Bangladesh
Grant to International Foundation for Electoral System to facilitate civil society dialogue on political reform and to promote peaceful political and electoral processes.

iati-activity.title: HR Capacity Gaps in the Water Sector
iati-activity.description: The strategic objective of this research is to provide much needed data, for use by senior decision makers, on the human resources (HR) capacity shortages and gap in the drinking water, sanitation and hygiene promotion sub-sectors. These HR gaps and shortages are widely recognized as one of the main constraints to progress in achieving the Millennium Development Goal (MDG) targets for the sector and for sustaining progress to achieve universal access to safe drinking water and adequate sanitation beyond 2015. Conducting national case studies is intended to help countries identify the HR capacity gaps and shortages they face in the sector and to assist them in planning to address their capacity constraints in the short, medium and long term.
iati-activity.sector: Water supply and sanitation - large systems

iati-activity.title: Skills and Employment Programme in Bangladesh
iati-activity.description: The Skills and Employment Programme – Bangladesh (SEP-B) aims to stimulate private sector investment in training for the poor, and in particular training that effectively supports women and disadvantaged populations into decent employment. Our assessments indicate that over the coming 4 years and 7 months, the programme could facilitate private sector-led training for 110,000 men and women and support 71,500 people into employment.

iati-activity.title: Creating Opportunities for the Poor and Excluded in Bangladesh (COPE)
iati-activity.description: To work with the most poor and marginalised people in Bangladesh to make them aware of their rights, and provide advice, advocacy support and organisation to claim those rights in practice. As a result of the programme, by December 2016, people who would otherwise be excluded from the benefits of development will gain access to services, assets and economic opportunities, and be given a greater say in decisions affecting their lives.

iati-activity.title: Strengthening Government Social Protection Systems for the Poor (SGSP)
iati-activity.description: Supporting the Government of Bangladesh through provision of technical assistance and advocacy to establish policies, budgets and plans for a more effective and efficient social protection system. This is expected to benefit around 78 million poor Bangladeshis through design and implementation of programmes which are better targeted to the poor and more focused on helping them lift themselves out of poverty. As a whole, this will support reform of the social protection system and improve the impact and sustainability of the Government’s own expenditure on social protection in Bangladesh. This contributes to MDG 1 ( ie eradication of extreme poverty and hunger) and will result in the reduction of number of people living in extreme poverty in Bangladesh but currently excluded from social protection schemes, by 2017.
iati-activity.sector: Public sector policy and administrative management

iati-activity.participating-org: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank
iati-activity.title: Building Capacity to Use Research Evidence
iati-activity.description: This programme aims to build the skills and knowledge of decision makers in low and middle income countries to access, appraise and use research evidence. This will enable governing bodies in the South to make better policy and programme decisions, ultimately enabling them to develop more rapidly and sustainably. It also includes an evaluation to strengthen the global evidence base on whether capacity building approaches to supporting evidence-informed policy making can be a cost effective way to reduce poverty.
iati-activity.sector: Public sector policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Supporting the National Action Plan for Ready-made Garment Sector in Bangladesh
iati-activity.description: To improve working conditions in the garment sector in Bangladesh by providing support to structural and fire assessments on around 1500 factories, strengthening the labour and factory inspection regime, providing occupational health and safety training to garment sector employees and increasing national health and safety awareness through media campaigns, improving dialogue between workers and management at individual factory and national level and supporting the rehabilitation of the survivors of recent industrial accidents.

iati-activity.title: South Asia Country Research Fund
iati-activity.description: This Fund has been set up to provide evidence for country offices in South Asia on emerging development research priorities identified in the Bilateral Aid Review (BAR) process. This will include research on rising urbanization, empowerment of women and girls, inclusive growth, education, and climate adaptation. Studies will be commissioned on the basis of demand from DFID country offices in Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Burma, India, Nepal and Pakistan and the context-specific evidence generated will inform the design of new programmes and improve implementation of ongoing programmes in these country offices. The £4.9 million programme will be delivered over 5 years. At the end of 5 years, it is expected that the evidence generated by the programme will also be useful for other donors and the wider development community. Gender will be a key focus in the programme.
